Dead By Daylight is a game with a steep learning curve. That being said, its extremely rewarding once you start to master the different aspects of the gameplay. I'm about 50 hours in and just hit rank 12. 

If you're looking for a casual game that you don't wanna invest time into, maybe pick something else. But if you want a new favorite game where you can feel yourself improving and have lots of awesome moments of adrenaline rush. Buy it right now

A unique game with some real thrilling moments is spoiled by clunky mechanics and thoughtless design, factors I believe heavily contribute to the player toxicity problem experienced by many. Below are a few negative experiences I have had with this game, ranging from nitpicks to major design flaws.

When working on generators, the way skill checks work allows you to instantly fail if you're unlucky enough to want to stop working at the exact moment the skill check sound plays.

The nature of rift challenges means that you'll often encounter games where killers will only be there to farm their quest objectives instead of playing.

Survivor player models experience collision with other survivor player models. This has the consequence of enabling unbelievably toxic behaviour like intentionally blocking other survivors, allowing them to be caught by killers or preventing escape.

Killers camping or tunnelling survivors is frowned upon, but they are natural tactics that emerge from the core gameplay. The community has had to come up with etiquette against these strategies because the game does nothing to soften the feelings of unfairness or help survivors feel like the match wasn't a complete waste if they become a victim of camping or tunnelling.

From a match perspective, there is no direct incentive for survivors to work together. Blood points are only ever based on personal performance. Other survivors only matter as much as they can boost your score by providing bodies to rescue and heal until you've maxed your altruism for that match. This ties into getting camped or tunnelled as you will never get anything for being the unfortunate survivor a killer has decided will stay hooked, allowing all other survivors free reign to complete generators.

There is hope for this game, but for the moment it's just not a consistently fun experience.
although they banned me for talk shitting a camper it's a great game8/10

Survivors: The game might seem like it's about escaping, but it's about being better at NOT DYING. Don't get caught up when you die.

Killers: yes, the entity likes when you kill everyone, but the entity also likes when you don't focus one person at a time. Get better by learning to pick different people off every time.

Both lads: HAVE FUN, the game is really fun once you get into the spirit of things, killing or chasing. highly recommended for playing with friends
